overview:
Diverse entrepreneur with great ideas and execution provided the team is solid and capable.

Bill is a very capable and dynamic individual. He tends to take on ever-increasing challenges in an effort to learn and master multiple disciplines and ventures. He joined the corporate world in 2003 after graduating from college and was promoted 3 times in 3 years, and by the time he left he was managing the P&L for the flagship accounts and had over 100 employees to manage. During the final 2 years of his employment he also completed an online MBA degree.

In addition to traveling internationally and experiencing many cultures, Bill is also self-taught on the guitar and formed a band in 2008. For the hell of it, they booked a gig in Hoboken NJ and were asked back to headline a few months later.

After he left his previous position, he joined the founder of a start up in NYC and began building an international trading business in the telecom space. Bill quickly developed into the sales role and put multi million $ deals together with various companies across 3 continents. He became a partner in the firm in 2007 and grew the company from 3 employees to over 90 worldwide. Revenues grew from under 1M to 12M in 3 years as profit margins grew to over 50%.

Sensing a need for change, Bill exited his partnership in Aug 2009 and consulted until January 2010 on business, sales/marketing and succession planning. Since then he took over a project called boardmybiz.com and has been working on getting the concept developed and the team set up so that he can continue pursuing new and exciting ventures.

In late 2009 Bill also took up Kung Fu as an added challenge and as a new discipline for his mind and body.
